author: Matthew Horwood
description: A new report by the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CHMC) says the recent downturn in Toronto’s condo market is unlikely to lead to a real estate crash similar to that seen in the 1990s, but acknowledges there are similarities to that time period. “We do not assess Toronto’s market as being overbuilt as it […]
title: Toronto Condo Market Downturn Unlikely to Lead to 1990s-Style Crash: CMHC Report

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A Bloc Québécois motion calling on the Liberal government to withdraw its factum filed with the Supreme Court around the use of the notwithstanding clause failed in the House of Commons. The vote failed on Sept. 24, with 159 “yays” and 170 “nays, as the Bloc and Conservatives voted in favour of the motion, and […]
title: Motion Calling for Ottawa to Withdraw From Legal Challenge on Notwithstanding Clauses Fails in House

description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis Prime Minister Mark Carney was at the United Nations General Assembly this week where numerous developments were occurring in foreign policy amidst notable global changes and conflicts. It was Carney’s first participation at the event in New York City as head of government, having previously served with the U.N. in a climate finance […]
title: Key Takeaways From Canada’s Foreign Policy Shifts and Moves as Carney Attends UN

author: The Canadian Press
description: A member of Parliament who has been a target of Chinese foreign interference says Canada should proceed with caution as it tries to mend its trading relationship with Beijing. NDP MP Jenny Kwan says that while the government needs to expand its trade ties, it must also protect Canada’s sovereignty and democracy. Prime Minister Mark […]
title: NDP MP Urges Caution as Canada Moves to Mend Trade Relationship With China

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has directed her minister of municipal affairs to conduct a review of how much elected municipal officials are paid, and to look for ways to limit “excessive” municipal property tax increases. Smith wrote a mandate letter to Municipal Affairs Minister Dan Williams this week, asking him to review municipal officials’ compensation […]
title: Alberta Premier Directs Minister to Review Pay of Municipal Officials, Limit Property Tax Increases

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government’s review of the controversial F-35 fighter jet procurement project is ongoing—despite Canadian officials repeatedly saying it would be completed by the end of summer. The Department of National Defence told The Canadian Press the F-35 review continues as federal bureaucrats examine the plans and consider the military’s needs. Defence Minister David McGuinty […]
title: Ottawa Still Reviewing F-35 Program After Its Summer Deadline Passes

description: The defendant, Guo Jian, was accused of gathering information while working for German politician Maximilian Krah.

author: Chandra Philip
description: Saskatchewan’s government is asking Canada’s highest court to expedite its appeal of a ruling that permits a legal challenge to the province’s school ‘pronoun policy’ to proceed. The province is calling the case a matter of national importance. Premier Scott Moe’s government introduced a policy in 2023, requiring schools to seek parental consent if a […]

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says he expects to eventually meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, as talks between Canada and China continue to “deepen” following recent official engagements. Carney made the comments on Sept. 23 on the sidelines of the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly in New York, following an in-person meeting […]

description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says her province won’t participate in the Liberal government’s gun buyback program and that its municipal police forces will focus on “real” policing priorities. “Alberta’s government will not be cooperating with this gun grab against law abiding firearms owners,” Smith said in a Sept. 23 X post. “We expect law enforcement […]
title: Premier Smith Says Alberta Won’t Cooperate With Federal Gun Buyback Program

author: Reuters
description: OTTAWA—Chinese surveillance camera manufacturer Hikvision said on Tuesday it would challenge a court decision upholding a Canadian government order to cease operations in Canada. The Federal Court on Monday dismissed a request from Hikvision to have the June order set aside. Ottawa says Hikvision operations in Canada could threaten national security. “We remain steadfast in […]
title: China’s Hikvision to Challenge Canadian Court Endorsement of Shutdown Order

author: Chandra Philip
description: Showing kindness to others may be the key to reducing feelings of loneliness and is more beneficial for mental health than taking “wellness breaks,” a new study suggests. Trinity Western University (TWU) psychology professor Yeeun Archer Lee studied more than 200 participants, randomly assigning them to either perform acts of kindness each day for two […]
title: Acts of Kindness Reduce Loneliness, Boost Mental Health More Than ‘Wellness Breaks’: Study

author: The Canadian Press
description: Indian’s new high commissioner to Canada is being sworn in this afternoon at Rideau Hall, following a series of high-level visits by Canadian officials. description: The minimum wage is increasing in Ontario, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Manitoba, and Saskatchewan as of Oct. 1. Minimum wage, the […]

description: B.C.
